key.name: mode
key.description: Select the proxy configuration mode. Supported values are "none", "manual", "auto".

key.name: autoconfig-url
key.description: URL that provides proxy configuration values.

key.name: ignore-hosts
key.description: This key contains a list of hosts which are connected to directly, rather than via the proxy (if it is active). The values can be hostnames, domains (using an initial wildcard like *.foo.com), IP host addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6) and network addresses with a netmask (something like 192.168.0.0/24).

key.name: use-same-proxy
key.summary: Use same proxy for all protocols
key.description: Whether to use the same proxy for all protocols or not.

key.name: enabled
key.description: Enables the proxy settings when accessing HTTP over the Internet.

key.name: host
key.description: The machine name to proxy HTTP through.

key.name: port
key.description: The port on the machine defined by "/system/proxy/http/host" that you proxy through.

key.name: use-authentication
key.description: If true, then connections to the proxy server require authentication. The username/password combo is defined by "/system/proxy/http/authentication-user" and "/system/proxy/http/authentication-password".

key.name: authentication-user
key.description: User name to pass as authentication when doing HTTP proxying.

key.name: authentication-password
key.description: Password to pass as authentication when doing HTTP proxying.

key.name: host
key.description: The machine name to proxy secure HTTP through.

key.name: port
key.description: The port on the machine defined by "/system/proxy/https/host" that you proxy through.

key.name: host
key.description: The machine name to proxy FTP through.

key.name: port
key.description: The port on the machine defined by "/system/proxy/ftp/host" that you proxy through.

key.name: host
key.description: The machine name to proxy socks through.

key.name: port
key.description: The port on the machine defined by "/system/proxy/socks/host" that you proxy through.
